floodArea.riverOrSea: Heighington Beck, Dunston Beck, Blankney Beck, Bil

items.message: Last week’s rainfall has caused levels to rise and remain high in the Minor Watercourses in North Kesteven. Further rainfall is forecast for the next the few days which could cause river levels to begin to rise. Watercourses in the area remain high, and will continue to flood nearby low lying land and roads over the next few days. We are monitoring river levels. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated Friday 25 October, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are high but steady on the Rivers Evenlode and Glyme as a result of further rainfall today (24/10/19). Therefore, a risk of flooding remains. No further rainfall is forecast until tomorrow morning (25/10/19). River levels are expected to remain steady, with no further rise forecast.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.
 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of property/roads and farmland is expected to begin later this evening. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road.   
We expect river levels to rise overnight and into tomorrow.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 25/10/19, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Mole and its tributaries from Kinnersley Manor to South Hersham
items.message: River levels are rising due to heavy rainfall in the area. As a result, flooding to low lying land and areas close to the River Mole is possible tonight, Thursday 24/10/19, from approximately 9pm. Flooding is mainly expected to affect areas nearest the River Mole between Kinnersley Manor and Sidlow, although there may be other areas of minor flooding. River levels in this area are expected to peak in the early hours tomorrow morning, 25/10/19, the flooding from the river will continue into the afternoon as some further rain showers could be experienced. No flooding to properties is expected at this time. Please stay safe in this area and avoid flooded footpaths and land. We will be monitoring this situation closely and are prepared to respond if required. This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow, Friday 25/10/19, or as the situation changes.
